de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.senv.utils

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.senv.utils.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a path in a graph. It consists of an array of vertex IDs (int) and an array of distances (double) between these vertices. The order of the vertex IDs in the array is the order in which they form the path.
    The distance between vertex_i and vertex_i+1 can be found in the distance array at position i.
    By this class' definition, a path consists of at least an initial and a final vertex which can be the same. The number of distances is the number of vertices minus one (A path with just one vertex has length 0). Alternatively, a path can be "empty" (dummy path)

      • connectPaths

        public static Path connectPaths(Path p1,
                                Path p2)
        Connects to path, where the end vertex of the first path should be the initial vertex of the second path
        Parameters:
        p1 - first path
        p2 - second path

      • getPartialPaths

        public Path[] getPartialPaths(int length)
        Determines all paths of a special length with at least two vertices which are contended in this path. E.g. Path (1,2,3) and length 2 would return (1,2),(2,3)
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the partial paths
